message.content: ation" are also sometimes referred to as educational philosophies. These philosophies examine the purpose and nature of education, and provide a framework for both understanding and assessing educational practices. Some examples of educational philosophies include perennialism, progressivism, and critical theory. Each of these philosophies approaches education from a unique perspective and has its own set of goals, values, and ideals. The study and analysis of educational philosophies is an important part of education sciences.
